newsitem.title: USA: System Software secures $12 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: System Software secures $12 mln loan.

text.p: System Software Associates Inc on Thursday said it secured a $12 million loan from a strategic investor.
The company, which develops and markets business application software, said the loan should resolve concerns over its short-term liquidity requirements.

System Software said the loan carries interest at the prime rate plus one percentage point and is convertible into its common stock at $3.33 per share or 80 percent of the stock fair market value at the time of conversion, which ever is less.
The loan, due in three years, is not convertible during the first year, except in the event of prepayment, System Software said.

System Software and its strategic investor, who the company did not identify in its statement, are starting discussions about a larger transaction involving an equity investment in the company at fair market value.
"The possible equity investment is not a precursor to the acquisition of System Software Associates," said chief executive officer Roger Covey in a statement.
